title: Jerusalem Talmud Kiddushin
text: ... "Someone who does one mitzvah, it is good for him, and his days will be lengthened, and he will inherit the land. And one who does one aveirah, it is not good for him, and his days will not be lengthened, and he will not inherit the land." There we teach: "Thus anyone who sits and does not sin, he is given the reward as if he did a mitzvah." Rabbi Z'eirah said: One who is about to do a doubtful aveirah and doesn't do it. Rabbi Yose bar Rabbi Bun said: One who designates one mitzvah for themselves and never transgressed it in his life. What's an example? Rabbi Mar Ukban said: Such as honouring parents...
